articles.author: Erin Banco
articles.description: The Palestinian militant group Hamas has recruited between 10,000 and 15,000 members since the start of its war with Israel, according to two congressional sources briefed on U.S. intelligence, suggesting the Iran-backed fighters could remain a persistent threat to Israel.
articles.title: Exclusive: Hamas has added up to 15,000 fighters since start of war, US figures show

articles.author: Idrees Ali, Phil Stewart
articles.description: U.S. military C-17 aircraft began flying out migrants on orders from President Donald Trump on Friday, as the Pentagon prepared to send even more troops to southern border, including from the Army's elite 82nd Airborne division.
articles.title: US military aircraft deport migrants, as Pentagon readies more troops for border

articles.author: Vladyslav Smilianets And Sergiy Karazy
articles.description: As snow fell in a wooded area of Ukraine, the long-range attack drones accelerated one by one down an unlit, abandoned road and their whirring engines propelled them into the night sky.
articles.title: Inside the Ukrainian drone unit conducting deep strikes on Russia

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: The U.S. State Department issued a "stop-work" order on Friday for all existing foreign assistance and paused new aid, according to a memo seen by Reuters, fulfilling an order issued by President Donald Trump.
articles.title: US stops work on foreign aid after Trump orders review

articles.author: David Lewis, Stephanie Van Den Berg, Reade Levinson
articles.description: One of Europe's most wanted fugitives, convicted cocaine smuggler Jos Leijdekkers, has found refuge and high-level protection in Sierra Leone, according to three sources with direct knowledge of the matter as well as photos and video footage seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: European cocaine kingpin has high level protection in Sierra Leone-sources

articles.author: Nandita Bose
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday he plans to sign an executive order to overhaul or eliminate the main federal agency that responds to natural disasters during a visit to storm-hit areas of North Carolina.
articles.title: Trump says he will order FEMA overhaul on tour of disaster-hit North Carolina

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Palestinian militant group Hamas announced the names on Friday of four Israeli female soldier hostages to be released in exchange for Palestinian prisoners in the second swap under the ceasefire deal in Gaza.
articles.title: Hamas names four Israeli female soldier hostages to be freed in second swap

articles.author: Alexandra Ulmer, Lizbeth Diaz
articles.description: After Honduran migrant Alex Diaz' U.S. asylum appointment was canceled following Donald Trump's immigration and border crackdown, the 23-year-old former bus driver began considering what he had been determined to avoid: entering the United States illegally.
articles.title: Some migrants turn to pricey smugglers or riskier routes after Trump clampdown

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Trump administration's Interior Department said on Friday it had officially changed the name of the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America, and the Alaskan peak Denali to Mount McKinley.
articles.title: Trump administration says 'Gulf of America' name change now official

articles.author: Alexander Tanas
articles.description: The leader of Moldova's separatist Transdniestria region, gripped by power and heating cuts, said on Friday that gas reserves would be exhausted within days and urged the central government to end "artificial delays" and provide new supplies.
articles.title: Moldova's separatist region says gas running out
